body:
@jeremy I think this is a misunderstanding -- this does not add anything to Rails itself for configuring the bcrypt cost, like #285.  This is merely using the new public API of bcrypt-ruby -- cost should be accessed by the `BCrypt::Engine.cost` attribute, which can additionally be set by the user however they desired, or not set at all -- it continues to default to the old `DEFAULT_COST` constant internally.

As it stands now, if a user uses the [provided and recommented `cost` accessor from bcrypt-ruby](https://github.com/codahale/bcrypt-ruby#cost-factors), Rails will ignore it and set it _back_ to `DEFAULT_COST` [here](https://github.com/tjschuck/rails/blob/dd13722c264a84e81ce15a6ec168c84d4db460ca/activemodel/lib/active_model/secure_password.rb#L106).
